Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery cup; interior glazed black; exterior: red-figure decoration consisting of naked youth or boy in profile to left (part of torso, left arm, left buttock and right leg remaining; dilute brown for minor interior markings), with possible drapery over arm.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis (according to G&R Department register; highly unlikely)
Found/Acquired: Orvieto (it was with P. Hertwig in 1893)
Curator's comments: Highly unlikely to be from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0708) (Phase 1)
